entry.title: Droughts Hurt World's Largest Economies
entry.content: Unusually dry weather across the Northern Hemisphere is further snarling supply chains and driving up the prices of food and energy, adding pressure to a global trade system already under stress.

entry.title: Russia Probes Killing of Putin Ally's Daughter
entry.content: Ukraine is on alert for renewed attacks in the run-up to its Independence Day, while Moscow launched an investigation after the daughter of Russian far-right ideologue Aleksandr Dugin died in a suspected car bombing.

entry.title: Russian Mercenaries Project the Kremlin's Power Far From Its Troubles in Ukraine
entry.content: Wagner Group, a private army formed by “Putin’s Chef,” is taking aim at Mali’s mineral riches in a strategic part of Africa. Its mercenaries are accused of massacring civilians.
